definitions.definition: A utensil; tool; a weapon; (usually in compound) an article in general.
A frame or machine of wood or other material, in which a weaver forms cloth out of thread; a machine for interweaving yarn or threads into a fabric, as in knitting or lace making.
The part of an oar which is between the grip or handle and the blade, the shaft.
A distorted appearance of something as seen indistinctly or from afar.
To appear indistinctly, eg. when seen on the horizon or through the murk.
definitions.example: The clouds loomed over the mountains.

definitions.definition: To appear in an exaggerated or threatening form; to be imminent.
To rise and to be eminent; to be elevated or ennobled, in a moral sense.
